pageContext.claim: “And some of the presidents, I guess they didn't care, or they wanted open borders. I don't think they wanted open borders. Because most of them, if you go back to 2006, they all approved, essentially, a wall -- a very powerful fence -- which is pretty much the same thing. But in 2006, if you look -- Obama, you look at Hillary Clinton, you look at Schumer, all of the people that are standing up protesting -- they think it's good for them politically.”
pageContext.analysis: Many Democrats voted for the Secure Fence Act of 2006, which was signed by President George W. Bush and authorized building a fence along about 700 miles of the border between the United States and Mexico. It passed 283-138 in the House, with 64 Democrat votes, and 80-19 in the Senate, with 26 Democrat votes. But the fence they voted for is not as substantial as the wall Trump is proposing. Trump himself has called the 2006 fence a "nothing wall."
